intro: Thelypodium integrifolium, commonly known as the smoothleaf thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Thelypodium integrifolium is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
